solution_line_template: Ayen jogged for a total of {daily_jog_minutes} x {regular_weekday_count} = <<{daily_jog_minutes}*{regular_weekday_count}={regular_weekday_jog_minutes}>>{regular_weekday_jog_minutes} minutes on Monday, Wednesday, and Thursday.
She jogged for {daily_jog_minutes} + {tuesday_extra_minutes} = <<{daily_jog_minutes}+{tuesday_extra_minutes}={tuesday_jog_minutes}>>{tuesday_jog_minutes} minutes on Tuesday.
She also jogged for {daily_jog_minutes} + {friday_extra_minutes} = <<{daily_jog_minutes}+{friday_extra_minutes}={friday_jog_minutes}>>{friday_jog_minutes} minutes on Friday.

So, Ayen jogged for a total of {regular_weekday_jog_minutes} + {tuesday_jog_minutes} + {friday_jog_minutes} = <<{regular_weekday_jog_minutes}+{tuesday_jog_minutes}+{friday_jog_minutes}={total_minutes_this_week}>>{total_minutes_this_week} minutes.
In hours, this is equal to {total_minutes_this_week} minutes / {minutes_per_hour} minutes/hour = <<{total_minutes_this_week}/{minutes_per_hour}={total_hours_this_week}>>{total_hours_this_week} hours.
